name: Blaze
description: Blaze increases the power of Fire-type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as in a pinch).

name: Berserk
description: Berserk raises the Pokémon's Special Attack by one stage when its HP falls below 50%.

name: Beast Boost
description: The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each time it knocks out a Pokémon.

name: Battle Armor
description: Battle Armor prevents the Pokémon from receiving a critical hit.

name: Battle Bond
description: Battle Bond causes Greninja to transform into Ash-Greninja when it KOs an opponent.Battle Bond also increases the power of Greninja's signature move Water Shuriken.

name: Big Pecks
description: Big Pecks prevents the ability-bearer's Defense stat from being lowered, for example via Tail Whip.

name: Beads of Ruin
description: Lowers Special Defense of all Pokémon except itself.

name: Bad Dreams
description: Bad Dreams causes all sleeping opponents to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP at the end of each turn.

name: Armor Tail
description: Armor Tail prevents the opponent from using any moves that have priority, such as Quick Attack.

name: As One
description: Combines Unnerve and Chilling Neigh/Grim Neigh

name: Aura Break
description: Aura Break cancels the effects of the abilities Fairy Aura and Dark Aura and instead reduces the power of Dark-type and Fairy-type moves by 25%, for all Pokémon on the field.Aura Break is not affected by the abilities Mold Breaker, Teravolt, or Turboblaze.Aura Break is the signature ability of Zygarde. Similarly, the abilities it reverses are also signature abilities of legendary Pokémon from Pokémon X&Y: Xerneas and Yveltal.

name: Arena Trap
description: Arena Trap prevents opponents from fleeing or switching out. Raised Pokémon are not affected.Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary.If a Pokémon with Arena Trap is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear.

name: Zero to Hero
description: Transforms into its Hero Form when switching out.

name: Steadfast
description: Raises Speed each time the Pokémon flinches.

name: Zen Mode
description: Zen Mode changes the ability-bearer's form to Zen Mode when their health falls below 50%.Currently it only applies to Darmanitan, whose form change makes it Fire/Psychic type and changes its stats around.

name: Wonder Skin
description: Wonder Skin halves the accuracy of all status moves targeted at the ability-bearer.It does not affect self-inflicted status moves like Reflect or Swords Dance, nor does it affect the secondary conditions of attacking moves like Flamethrower.

name: Wind Rider
description: Wind Rider gives immunity to wind moves, and causes the Pokémon's Attack to increase by one stage when hit by one.

name: White Smoke
description:
Prevents other Pokémon from lowering its stats.		
					If a Pokémon with White Smoke is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.

name: Ball Fetch
description: If the Pokémon is not holding an item, it will fetch the Poké Ball from the first failed throw of the battle.

name: Battery
description: Battery allows the Pokémon to raise the power of teammates' special moves.

name: Water Veil
description: Prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.

name: Anticipation
description: A Pokémon with Anticipation will shudder upon entering battle, if an opponent has a move that is super-effective against it, or a One-Hit-KO move (Fissure, Horn Drill, Guillotine or Sheer Cold). It only activates when the ability-bearer switches in, not when an opponent switches in.Anticipation does not activate if the opponent has a move that varies in type, such as Hidden Power, Judgment or Weather Ball, even if those moves would be super-effective.

name: Aroma Veil
description: Protects allies from attacks that limit their move choices.

name: Water Absorb
description: A Pokémon with Water Absorb heals 1⁄4 of its maximum HP when hit by a Water-type attack.

name: Wimp Out
description: Wimp Out causes the bearer to switch out (or flee in a wild battle) when its HP falls below 50%.

name: Wind Power
description: If a Pokémon with Wind Power is hit by a wind move, the power of the next Electric-type move it uses is doubled.

name: Wandering Spirit
description: Swaps abilities with opponents on contact.

name: Wonder Guard
description: Wonder Guard prevents damage from direct attacks unless they are super-effective. Shedinja is the only Pokémon to have this ability so this means that only Fire, Flying, Rock, Ghost and Dark moves will have an effect.However, Pokémon protected by Wonder Guard are not immune to indirect attacks. Status-category moves still work and all end-of-turn damage will still incur, for example from poisoning, burns, sandstorms or hail. Entry hazards such as Spikes or Stealth Rock will also damage Pokémon with Wonder Guard switching in. Attacks that do not take their type in account will also hit, such as Struggle, Beat Up or Future Sight. Since Shedinja only has 1 HP, any of the above damage will result in an instant knockout.

name: Well-Baked Body
description: Immune to Fire-type moves, and Defense is sharply boosted.

name: Vital Spirit
description: Vital Spirit prevents the ability-bearer from falling asleep. This means that it also prevents the use of the move Rest.If a Pokémon with Vital Spirit is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

name: Victory Star
description: Boosts the accuracy of its allies and itself.

name: Vessel of Ruin
description: Lowers Special Attack of all Pokémon except itself.

name: Unseen Fist
description: Contact moves can strike through Protect/Detect.

name: Weak Armor
description: When a Pokémon with Weak Armor is hit by a physical move, its Defense drops one stage, but its Speed increases by one stage.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Unburden
description: Raises Speed if a held item is used.

name: Unaware
description: Ignores any stat changes in the Pokémon.

name: Unnerve
description: Makes the foe nervous and unable to eat Berries.

name: Turboblaze
description: Turboblaze prevents a target's ability from affecting moves that the Turboblaze Pokémon uses. It only affects abilities that change the power, accuracy or other effects of moves.For example, Reshiram would be able to hit Bronzong (having Levitate) using a Ground-type move like Earth Power. Ground type moves would still not affect Flying types.However, using Dragon Claw against a Pokémon with Aftermath would still receive HP loss as Aftermath did not affect the Dragon Claw attack itself.

name: Water Compaction
description: Water Compaction raises the bearer's Defense by 2 stages when it is hit by a Water-type move.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Trace
description: The Pokémon copies a foe's Ability.

name: Water Bubble
description: Water Bubble reduces damage taken from Fire-type moves by 50%, and doubles the power of Water-type moves used by the ability-bearer. It also prevents the Pokémon from being burned.

name: Toxic Boost
description: Powers up physical attacks when poisoned.

name: Torrent
description: Torrent increases the power of Water-type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as in a pinch).

name: Volt Absorb
description: A Pokémon with Volt Absorb heals 1⁄4 of its maximum HP when hit by an Electric-type attack, including Thunder Wave.In Generation 3, Volt Absorb does not activate for Thunder Wave.

name: Thick Fat
description: Thick Fat reduces the damage taken from Fire-type and Ice-type moves by 50%.Interestingly, many Pokémon possessing this ability already take reduced damage from those types. A Dewgong or Walrein with Thick Fat would take 1⁄8 normal damage when hit by an Ice-type move.

name: Triage
description: Triage increases the priority of HP-restoring moves to +3, when used by the ability-bearer.Note: as Comfey is currently the only Pokémon with this ability, the only moves affected in practice are Draining Kiss, Floral Healing, Rest, and Synthesis.

name: Truant
description: Truant causes the ability-bearer to only attack every alternate turn. On the even turns, it will say the Pokémon is loafing around.If a Pokémon with Truant uses a move that requires recharging on the second turn (such as Hyper Beam), it will recharge on the same turn the Pokémon loafs around. Moves where the user prepares on the first turn and attacks on the second (such as Solarbeam or Fly) cannot be used.The moves Worry Seed, Entrainment and Simple Beam do not work on Pokémon with Truant.Truant can technically be Skill Swapped away, however neither Slakoth, Slaking or Durant learn it.

name: Toxic Debris
description: Scatters poison spikes at the feet of the opposing team when the Pokémon takes damage from physical moves.

name: Transistor
description: Transistor increases the power of Electric-type moves used by this Pokémon by 50%.It is the signature ability of Regieleki.

name: Teravolt
description: Teravolt prevents a target's ability from affecting moves that the Teravolt Pokémon uses. It only affects abilities that change the power, accuracy or other effects of moves.For example, Zekrom would be able to hit Bronzong (having Levitate) using a Ground-type move like Earth Power. Ground type moves would still not affect Flying types.However, using Dragon Claw against a Pokémon with Aftermath would still receive HP loss as Aftermath did not affect the Dragon Claw attack itself.

name: Toxic Chain
description: Toxic Chain may cause bad poisoning when the Pokémon hits an opponent with a move.Toxic Chain is a new ability available in the Scarlet/Violet DLC.

name: Teraform Zero
description: When Terapagos changes into its Stellar Form, it uses its hidden powers to eliminate all effects of weather and terrain, reducing them to zero.

name: Tera Shift
description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it absorbs the energy around itself and transforms into its Terastal Form.

name: Telepathy
description: Pokémon with the Telepathy ability will not take damage from teammates in double and triple battles.This affects moves such as Surf and Earthquake, which normally hit all Pokémon on the field apart from the user.

name: Technician
description: Technician increases the power of moves - that are usually base power 60 or below - by 50%.Moves with variable base power are boosted only when it is 60 or below. For example, if Magnitude hits at level 6 it will be boosted from 50 to 75, but level 7 will stay at 70 base power.Moves like Sonic Boom that deal fixed HP damage are not affected by Technician.

name: Tangling Hair
description: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker's Speed stat.

name: Tough Claws
description: Tough Claws increases the power of moves that make contact.Most Physical-category moves are contact moves.

name: Tangled Feet
description: Raises evasion if the Pokémon is confused.

name: Tera Shell
description: The Pokémon’s shell contains the powers of each type. All damage-dealing moves that hit the Pokémon when its HP is full will not be very effective.

name: Tinted Lens
description: Powers up “not very effective” moves.

name: Swift Swim
description: Swift Swim doubles the ability-bearer's Speed during rain.

name: Tablets of Ruin
description: Lowers Attack of all Pokémon except itself.

name: Synchronize
description: If the opponent causes a burn, paralysis, or poisoning of a Pokémon with Synchronize, the opponent receives the status condition too. Self-inflicted status conditions (for example through the use of an item) are not passed on.In Generations 3-4, bad poison is only passed on as regular poison.If a Pokémon with Synchronize is the leading party Pokémon, there is a 50% chance of each wild Pokémon encountered having the same nature.

name: Swarm
description: Swarm increases the power of Bug-type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as in a pinch).If a Pokémon with Swarm is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear.

name: Surge Surfer
description: Surge Surfer doubles the bearer's Speed when Electric Terrain is active.

name: Supreme Overlord
description: Attack and Special Attack are boosted for each party Pokémon that has been defeated.

name: Thermal Exchange
description: Raises Attack when hit by a Fire-type move. Cannot be burned.

name: Super Luck
description: Super Luck raises the ability-bearer's critical-hit ratio by one stage (for most moves this increases from a 1⁄16 chance to 1⁄8).

name: Suction Cups
description: Suction Cups prevents opponents forcing the ability-bearer to switch out or flee via the moves Roar, Whirlwind, Circle Throw, or Dragon Tail, or the item Red Card.If a Pokémon with Suction Cups is the leading party Pokémon, the chance of hooking a Pokémon during fishing increases.

name: Sturdy
description: Sturdy allows the Pokémon to survive with 1 HP if attacked at full HP with an attack that would otherwise knock it out. It also prevents One-Hit-KO moves (Fissure, Horn Drill, Guillotine or Sheer Cold).If Sturdy activates before the final hit of a multi-hit move (such as Fury Swipes), the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the Pokémon to faint.Sturdy does not prevent self-inflicted KO moves such as Selfdestruct, Explosion and Final Gambit.

name: Storm Drain
description: Storm Drain forces all single-target Water-type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. The ability is most useful in double/triple battles.When hit by the move, it deals no damage to the ability-bearer but raises its Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.Storm Drain will activate for an Water-type Hidden Power, but not Water-type Judgment.The ability is overridden by other Pokémon becoming the center of attention from the moves Follow Me or Rage Powder.In Generation 4, Storm Drain did not increase Special Attack nor give immunity to Water-type attacks. It also did not activate for Hidden Power.

name: Sticky Hold
description: Sticky Hold prevents held items from being taken or switched.If a Pokémon with Sticky Hold is the leading party Pokémon, the chance of hooking a Pokémon during fishing increases.

name: Sword of Ruin
description: Lowers Defense of all Pokémon except itself.

name: Symbiosis
description: The Pokémon can pass an item to an ally.

name: Sweet Veil
description: Sweet Veil prevents this Pokémon and its allies from falling asleep, for example from moves like Hypnosis.

name: Steam Engine
description: Steam Engine raises the user's Speed by three stages when it is hit by a Fire- or Water-type attack. The attack still deals damage.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.If a Pokémon with Steam Engine (or Flame Body or Magma Armor) and a Pokémon Egg are both in the party Pokémon, the number of steps required to hatch the egg are halved.

name: Static
description: If a Pokémon with Static is hit by a move making contact, there is a 30% chance the foe will become paralyzed.If a Pokémon with Static is the leading party Pokémon, it is 50% more likely that a wild Pokémon encountered will be Electric type.

name: Stance Change
description: Stance Change is exclusive to Aegislash. When using a damage-dealing move, Aegislash switches to its Blade Forme. When using the move King's Shield, Aegislash switches to its Shield Forme.The form change occurs when the appropriate move is selected, regardless of whether the attack goes ahead (e.g. prevented by paralysis).

name: Stamina
description: Stamina raises the bearer's Defense by one stage when it is attacked by any move.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Stall
description: The Pokémon moves after all other Pokémon do.

name: Stalwart
description: Ignores moves and abilities that draw in moves.

name: Supersweet Syrup
description: A sickly sweet scent spreads across the field the first time the Pokémon enters a battle, lowering the evasiveness of opposing Pokémon.

name: Stakeout
description: Stakeout enables the Pokémon to deal twice the normal damage to any Pokémon that switches in or enters the field mid-battle.

name: Speed Boost
description: Its Speed stat is gradually boosted.

name: Soul-Heart
description: Soul-Heart raises the bearer's Special Attack one stage when any Pokémon on the field faints.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Stench
description: A Pokémon with Stench has a 10% chance of causing the opponent to flinch when hit by a damaging move (provided the ability-bearer strikes first as usual).Stench does not stack with the items King's Rock or Razor Fang, so an ability-bearer holding either item will keep the flinch chance at 10%.In Generations 3-4, Stench has no effect in battle.If a Pokémon with Stench is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.

name: Solid Rock
description: Solid Rock reduces the damage taken from super-effective attacks by 25%.For example, a Water-type move used against a Rock-type Pokémon with Solid Rock would deal 1.5× the usual damage instead of 2×. A double weakness would be reduced from 4× to 3×.

name: Solar Power
description: During harsh sunlight, Solar Power raises the ability-bearer's Special Attack by 50%, but it also loses 1⁄8 of its maximum HP after each turn.

name: Sniper
description: Sniper increases the power of critical hits by 1.5×. This means a critical hit will deal 2.25× normal damage instead of 1.5×.In Generations 1-5 critical hits deal 2× normal damage, so Sniper inflicts 3× normal damage.

name: Slush Rush
description: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in a hailstorm.

name: Snow Cloak
description: Snow Cloak raises ability-bearer's evasion by 20% in a hail storm. It also gives immunity to damage by hail (if they are not already protected by being Ice type).If a Pokémon with Snow Cloak is the leading party Pokémon while travelling in a hail storm/blizzard, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.

name: Steely Spirit
description: Powers up ally Pokémon's Steel-type moves.

name: Steelworker
description: Steelworker increases the power of Steel-type moves used by this Pokémon by 50%.

name: Skill Link
description: Skill Link causes multi-strike moves to always hit their maximum number of times. The moves affected are listed below; note that moves such as Double Kick that always strike the same number of times are not affected.In Generation 4, Triple Kick is not affected by Skill Link.

name: Shell Armor
description: Shell Armor prevents the Pokémon from receiving a critical hit.

name: Slow Start
description: Temporarily halves Attack and Speed.

name: Shield Dust
description: Blocks the added effects of attacks taken.

name: Sheer Force
description: Sheer Force increases the power of moves that have beneficial secondary effects by 30%, but removes those additional effects.Beneficial effects are defined as those that are positive for the user, such as:Non-beneficial effects, that Sheer Force will not activate for, include:If the user is holding a Life Orb and uses an attack that activates Sheer Force, it will not receive the 10% damage from Life Orb, but it gets boosts from both Life Orb and Sheer Force (total of 69% base power increase).Flamethrower normally has a 10% chance to burn the opponent. With Sheer Force, Flamethrower's base power is boosted from 95 to 124, but it will never cause a burn.Note that if a move has an advantageous and disadvantageous side-effect, Sheer Force still boosts the move but only the advantageous effect is removed. For example, Flare Blitz may cause a burn but also has recoil damage. A Pokémon with Sheer Force using the move would gain the power increase and still receive recoil damage, but it would never cause a burn.Here are the moves that increase in power under Sheer Force, listed alphabetically:

name: Shed Skin
description: The Pokémon may heal its own status problems.

name: Shadow Tag
description: Prevents the foe from escaping.

name: Soundproof
description: Soundproof grants the Pokémon immunity to all sound-based moves, preventing all damage and effects.In Generation 5 only, Pokémon with Soundproof could be cured of status conditions by Heal Bell.

name: Snow Warning
description: Snow Warning creates a hailstorm when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via Air Lock or Cloud Nine or replaced by another weather condition.If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities (Snow Warning, Drizzle, Drought or Sand Stream) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon.Prior to Generation 6, Snow Warning lasts indefinitely upon activation.

name: Shadow Shield
description: Reduces damage when HP is full.

name: Serene Grace
description: Serene Grace doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring - specifically stat changes, status ailments, or flinching. It also increases the chance of flinching due to the held items King's Rock and Razor Fang from 10% to 20% (however, note that those items do not affect moves that already have a flinch chance).Serene Grace does not affect status moves or the Pokémon's critical hit ratio.Shadow Ball normally has a 20% chance of lowering Special Defense; with Serene Grace it is boosted to a 40% chance.Air Slash has a 30% of causing the target to flinch; with Serene Grace it is boosted to a 60% chance. If the item King's Rock is held it does not increase that percentage, but rather if the move does not cause flinching (40% chance), then there is now a further 20% chance the target will flinch from King's Rock. This means Serene Grace with Air Slash and King's Rock gives a total probability of 68% (1 - 0.4*0.8) that the opponent will flinch.In Generations 3-4 Serene Grace does not increase the flinch chance of King's Rock or Razor Fang.In Generations 3-5 Serene Grace does not affect the move Secret Power.

name: Screen Cleaner
description: Nullifies effects of Light Screen, Reflect, and Aurora Veil.

name: Sand Veil
description: Sand Veil raises the ability-bearer's evasion by 20% in a sandstorm. It also gives immunity to sandstorm damage (if they are not already protected by being Ground/Rock/Steel type).If a Pokémon with Sand Veil is the leading party Pokémon while travelling in a sandstorm, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.

name: Sap Sipper
description: Boosts Attack when hit by a Grass-type move.

name: Sand Stream
description: Sand Stream creates a sandstorm when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via Air Lock or Cloud Nine or replaced by another weather condition.If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities (Sand Stream, Drizzle, Drought or Snow Warning) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon.Prior to Generation 6, Sand Stream lasts indefinitely upon activation.

name: Sand Rush
description: Sand Rush doubles the ability-bearer's Speed during a sandstorm.

name: Sand Spit
description: Creates a sandstorm when hit by an attack.

name: Sand Force
description: Sand Force raises the power of Ground, Rock and Steel type moves by 30% during a sandstorm.It also grants immunity to the sandstorm damage, if not already immune (currently this only applies to Shellos since all other Pokémon with the ability are already immune).

name: Shields Down
description: Shields Down causes the Pokémon to changes its appearance and stats depending on its remaining HP.When the Pokémon's HP is over 50%, it has higher defenses and is immune to status conditions. When its HP falls below 50%, the outer shell breaks and the Pokémon has higher attack.

name: Run Away
description: Run Away allows the bearer to flee a battle with a wild Pokémon without fail, even if the opposing Pokémon has used a move like Mean Look or Bind, or has an ability such as Arena Trap.Pokémon with Run Away cannot switch out for another Pokémon, only flee. It does not allow the Pokémon to flee from Trainer battles.

name: Rough Skin
description: When a Pokémon with Rough Skin is hit by a move that makes contact, the attacker receives damage equal to 1⁄8 of their maximum HP.Multi-hit moves (e.g. DoubleSlap) activate Rough Skin for each strike.In Generation 3, the damage from Rough Skin is 1⁄16 of the maximum HP.

name: Rocky Payload
description: Rocky Payload increases the power of Rock-type moves used by this Pokémon by 50%.

name: Rock Head
description: Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.

name: RKS System
description: Changes type depending on held item.

name: Rivalry
description: Deals more damage to a Pokémon of same gender.

name: Regenerator
description: A Pokémon with Regenerator restores 1⁄3 of its maximum HP when switching out.

name: Refrigerate
description: Refrigerate causes all Normal-type attacking moves used by the Pokémon to become Ice-type, and increase in power by 20%.Ice-type Pokémon also gain STAB from those moves (which means an effective increase of 80%).In Generation 6, Refrigerate increases affected moves' power by 30%.

name: Receiver
description: A Pokémon with Receiver will inherit the ability of a teammate in a double/triple battle when that teammate faints.Abilities that activate upon entering the field, such as Intimidate, will activate when the Pokémon with Receiver inherits it.

name: Scrappy
description: Enables moves to hit Ghost-type Pokémon.

name: Seed Sower
description: Turns the ground into Grassy Terrain when the Pokémon is hit by an attack.

name: Rain Dish
description: A Pokémon with Rain Dish will recover 1⁄16 of its maximum HP during rain, after each turn.

name: Rattled
description: When a Pokémon with Rattled is hit by a Bug, Ghost or Dark type move, its Speed is raised one stage (up to the usual maximum of +6 stages).

name: Quick Feet
description: Quick Feet raises the ability-bearer's Speed by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep). If paralyzed, the Pokémon does not suffer the usual drop in Speed.All other effects of the status condition remain, e.g. losing HP each turn (poison, burn), or being unable to attack (paralysis, freeze, sleep).If a Pokémon with Quick Feet is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.

name: Pure Power
description: Raises the Pokémon's Attack stat.

name: Purifying Salt
description: Protects from status conditions and halves damage from Ghost-type moves.

name: Queenly Majesty
description: Prevents use of priority moves.

name: Punk Rock
description: Boosts sound-based moves and halves damage from the same moves.

name: Schooling
description: Schooling changes Wishiwashi into its School Form, if its HP is above 25% and Wishiwashi is at least level 20. If its HP falls below 25%, Wishiwashi will revert back to Solo Form.Schooling cannot be removed or replaced via moves like Skill Swap or the Mummy ability.

name: Protean
description: Protean changes the Pokémon's type to that of its previously used attack.

name: Protosynthesis
description: Raises highest stat in harsh sunlight, or if holding Booster Energy.

name: Psychic Surge
description: Psychic Surge creates a low-lying psychic field, like the move Psychic Terrain, when the Pokémon enters battle. It prevents high-priority moves being used and increases the power of Psychic type attacks.

name: Primordial Sea
description: Primordial Sea creates heavy rain when the ability is activated (by Kyogre reverting to its Primal form).Heavy rain has the same effects as regular rain but with some additions:The abilities Cloud Nine or Air Lock are still able to bypass the effects of Primordial Sea, but Mold Breaker is not.

name: Ripen
description: Doubles the effect of berries.

name: Prankster
description: Prankster increases the priority of status moves by +1.This means that a slower Pokémon with Prankster can use a status move before the opponent uses a regular move. Or if the ability-bearer is faster, it could use a status move before the opponent uses a priority move like Aqua Jet.The move Quick Guard does not block moves whose priority is increased by Prankster (but it does block moves that already have increased priority).

name: Pressure
description: Pressure makes any attack targeted at the ability-bearer - regardless of whether it hits - use 2 PP instead of 1.If a Pokémon with Pressure is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

name: Poison Puppeteer
description: Pokémon poisoned by Pecharunt’s moves will also become confused.

name: Poison Touch
description: May poison targets when a Pokémon makes contact.

name: Poison Heal
description: Restores HP if the Pokémon is poisoned.

name: Poison Point
description: Contact with the Pokémon may poison the attacker.

name: Quark Drive
description: Raises highest stat on Electric Terrain, or if holding Booster Energy.

name: Pixilate
description: Pixilate causes all Normal-type attacking moves used by the Pokémon to become Fairy-type, and increase in power by 20%.Fairy-type Pokémon also gain STAB from those moves (which means an effective increase of 80%).In Generation 6, Pixilate increases affected moves' power by 30%.

name: Pickup
description: When another Pokémon on the field uses a single-use held item, a Pokémon with Pickup will obtain the used item (if they are not already holding anything) and it can be used again.Pokémon with Pickup will also obtain an item thrown at them with Fling (if they are not already holding anything).In Generations 3-4, Pickup has no effect in battle.When a battle ends, any party Pokémon with Pickup has a 10% chance of picking up an item (if they are not already holding an item).Items picked up range from Potions, Great Balls, Ultra Balls and Rare Candies up to Leftovers and some TMs. Better items have a lower chance of being found; furthermore, higher-level Pokémon will obtain better items.

name: Propeller Tail
description: Ignores moves and abilities that draw in moves.

name: Prism Armor
description: Prism Armor reduces the damage taken from super-effective attacks by 25%. It is not affected by the abilities Mold Breaker, Teravolt, or Turboblaze.For example, a Dark-type move used against a Psychic-type Pokémon with Prism Armor would deal 1.5× the usual damage instead of 2×. A double weakness would be reduced from 4× to 3×.

name: Perish Body
description: When hit by a move that makes direct contact, the Pokémon and the attacker will faint after three turns unless they switch out of battle.

name: Power Spot
description: Just being next to the Pokémon powers up moves.

name: Parental Bond
description: Parental Bond allows the ability-bearer to attack twice. The second attack hits with 25% of the power, so in effect it is equivalent to a 25% boost to all attacks.Parental Bond is the signature ability of Mega Kangaskhan. When the ability is in use, the mother and child each attack.In Generation 6, the second attack of Parental Bond hits with 50% power of the first.

name: Power Construct
description: Power Construct is unique to Zygarde. When Zygarde 10% Forme or Zygarde 50% Forme falls below half HP, it changes into Zygarde Complete Forme.As Complete Forme has a higher base HP than the other two Formes, its HP is also restored by the same amount the maximum HP increased.

name: Power of Alchemy
description: The Pokémon copies the Ability of a defeated ally.

name: Own Tempo
description: Prevents the Pokémon from becoming confused.

name: Overgrow
description: Overgrow increases the power of Grass-type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as in a pinch).

name: Overcoat
description: Overcoat makes the Pokémon immune to residual damage from weather conditions (specifically Hail and Sandstorm).

name: Opportunist
description: Copies stat boosts by the opponent.

name: Normalize
description: Normalize causes all moves used by the Pokémon to become Normal-type, and attacking moves increase in power by 20%.Normal-type Pokémon also gain STAB from those moves (which means an effective increase of 80%).The following moves are not affected by Normalize: Hidden Power, Judgment, Multi-Attack, Natural Gift, Revelation Dance, Struggle, Techno Blast, Weather Ball, and damaging Z-Moves.The move Flying Press deals Normal/Flying type damage instead of Fighting/Flying. Freeze-Dry remains super-effective against Water-types, but follows the Normal type chart against other types (e.g. neutral against Grass-types).In Generations 4-6, Normalize did not increase damage (besides any usual boosts like STAB). All moves listed above except Struggle are affected by Normalize.

name: No Guard
description: No Guard ensures that all attacks used by, and targeted at, the ability-bearer hit without fail.This includes moves used on a Pokémon in the hidden stages of the moves Fly, Dive, Dig and Shadow Force.If a Pokémon with No Guard is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear.

name: Natural Cure
description: All status problems heal when it switches out.

name: Pickpocket
description: Steals an item when hit by another Pokémon.

name: Plus
description: Ups Sp. Atk if another Pokémon has Plus or Minus.

name: Mummy
description: Contact with this Pokémon spreads this Ability.

name: Pastel Veil
description: Pastel Veil prevents the Pokémon and its teammates from being poisoned. It also cures teammates of poisoning when it enters the battlefield.

name: Multiscale
description: Reduces damage when HP is full.

name: Orichalcum Pulse
description: Turns the sunlight harsh when entering battle, and boosts Attack while active.

name: Motor Drive
description: Raises Speed if hit by an Electric-type move.

name: Oblivious
description: Oblivious makes the Pokémon immune to gender-based moves and abilities, specifically Attract, Captivate and Cute Charm.

name: Moody
description: Raises one stat and lowers another.

name: Neutralizing Gas
description: Neutralizes abilities of all Pokémon in battle.

name: Mold Breaker
description: Mold Breaker prevents a target's ability from affecting moves that the Mold Breaker Pokémon uses. It only affects abilities that change the power, accuracy or other effects of moves.For example, a Haxorus with Mold Breaker would be able to hit a Bronzong (having Levitate) using a Ground type move like Earthquake. Ground type moves would still not affect Flying types.However, if Dragon Claw KOs a Pokémon with Aftermath, a Mold Breaker Pokémon would still lose HP as Aftermath did not affect the Dragon Claw attack itself.

name: Neuroforce
description: Powers up moves that are super effective.

name: Mirror Armor
description: Reflects any stat-lowering effects.

name: Mycelium Might
description: Status moves go last, but are not affected by the opponent's ability.

name: Merciless
description: The Pokémon's attacks become critical hits if the target is poisoned.

name: Marvel Scale
description: Marvel Scale raises the ability-bearer's Defense by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep).All effects of the status condition remain, e.g. losing HP each turn (poison, burn), speed drop (paralysis) or being unable to attack (paralysis, freeze, sleep).

name: Magnet Pull
description: Magnet Pull prevents Steel type Pokémon from switching out of battle or fleeing.If a Pokémon with Magnet Pull is the leading party Pokémon, it is 50% more likely that a wild Pokémon encountered will be Steel type.

name: Magma Armor
description: Magma Armor prevents the Pokémon from becoming frozen, for example from moves like Blizzard.If a Pokémon with Magma Armor (or Flame Body or Steam Engine) and a Pokémon Egg are amongst the party Pokémon, the number of steps required to hatch the egg are halved.

name: Moxie
description: Moxie increases the user's Attack one stage upon fainting an opponent.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Misty Surge
description: Misty Surge creates a low-lying mist, like the move Misty Terrain, when the bearer enters battle. It protects all grounded Pokémon from status conditions and halves the power of Dragon type attacks.

name: Minus
description: Ups Sp. Atk if another Pokémon has Plus or Minus.

name: Magic Guard
description: Magic Guard protects the Pokémon from indirect damage, including:It does not prevent damage from confusion, trapping moves (e.g. Bind) or Struggle.In Generation 4 a Pokémon with Magic Guard cannot be poisoned from Toxic Spikes, nor become fully immobile through paralysis (though the Speed drop still occurs).

name: Mind's Eye
description: The Pokémon ignores changes to opponents' evasiveness, its accuracy can't be lowered, and it can hit Ghost types with Normal- and Fighting-type moves.

name: Magic Bounce
description: Reflects status- changing moves.

name: Long Reach
description: The Pokémon uses its moves without making contact with the target.

name: Magician
description: The Pokémon steals the held item of a Pokémon it hits with a move.

name: Mimicry
description: Changes type depending on the terrain.

name: Libero
description: Libero changes the Pokémon's type to that of its previously used attack.

name: Light Metal
description: Light Metal halves the Pokémon's weight in battle. Decreasing weight affects these moves:

name: Limber
description: The Pokémon is protected from paralysis.

name: Levitate
description: Levitate causes the Pokémon to be raised (like Flying-type Pokémon).Raised Pokémon are not affected by Ground-type moves, Spikes, Toxic Spikes nor Arena Trap. Full details in glossary.

name: Leaf Guard
description: Leaf Guard prevents the bearer from succumbing to major status ailments (sleep, burns, poisoning, paralysis or freezing) during sunny weather.It does not prevent minor status ailments such as Confusion or Infatuation, nor does it prevent self-inflicted status conditions such as from using Rest.

name: Keen Eye
description: Keen Eye prevents the Pokémon from losing accuracy, for example from moves like Sand-Attack.If a Pokémon with Keen Eye is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% less likely to be lower level.

name: Justified
description: Justified raises the ability-bearer's Attack by one stage when hit by a damaging Dark-type move.The Attack rises for every hit of the move Beat Up.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Iron Barbs
description: When a Pokémon with Iron Barbs is hit by a move that makes contact, the attacker receives damage equal to 1⁄8 of their maximum HP.Multi-hit moves (e.g. DoubleSlap) activate Iron Barbs for each strike.

name: Intrepid Sword
description: Boosts Attack in battle.

name: Intimidate
description: Intimidate lower's the Attack of all opponents by one stage when the ability-bearer switches in (including the start of a battle).Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.If a Pokémon with Intimidate is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% less likely to be lower level.

name: Insomnia
description: Insomnia prevents the ability-bearer from falling asleep, both from moves by other Pokémon like Sing, and self-inflicted sleep like Rest.If a sleeping Pokémon aquires Insomnia (e.g. from Worry Seed, it will wake up on its next turn.

name: Inner Focus
description: Inner Focus prevents the Pokémon from flinching, for example when attacked by a move like Headbutt.

name: Innards Out
description: When a Pokémon with Innards Out faints, it deals damage to the opponent equal to amount of damage it took on the final blow.

name: Liquid Ooze
description: Damages attackers using any draining move.

name: Imposter
description: It transforms itself into the Pokémon it is facing.

name: Liquid Voice
description: Liquid Voice causes all sound-based moves used by the Pokémon to become Water type. Water type Pokémon also gain STAB from those moves.It is the signature ability of the Primarina evolution line, though other Pokémon may acquire Liquid Voice via certain abilities or moves such as Skill Swap.Attacks shown in bold can be learned by Primarina, though the others can be called via moves such as Metronome.

name: Lightning Rod
description: Lightning Rod forces all single-target Electric-type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. This includes the status move Thunder Wave. The ability is most useful in double/triple battles.When hit by the move, it deals no damage to the ability-bearer but raises its Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.Lightning Rod will activate for an Electric-type Hidden Power, but not Electric-type Judgment.The ability is overridden by other Pokémon becoming the center of attention from the moves Follow Me or Rage Powder.In Generations 3-4, Lightning Rod did not increase Special Attack nor give immunity to Electric-type attacks. It also did not activate for Hidden Power.In Generations 3-5, this ability's name was formatted as Lightningrod.

name: Lingering Aroma
description: Contact changes the attacker's Ability to Lingering Aroma.

name: Immunity
description: Prevents the Pokémon from getting poisoned.

name: Ice Scales
description: Halves damage from Special moves.

name: Illuminate
description: Illuminate has no effect in battle.If a Pokémon with Illuminate is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear.

name: Ice Body
description: A Pokémon with Ice Body will recover 1⁄16 of its maximum HP during hail, after each turn. It also grants immunity to the hailstorm damage, if not already immune.

name: Klutz
description: The Pokémon can't use any held items.

name: Hyper Cutter
description: Hyper Cutter prevents the bearer's Attack stat from being lowered by other Pokémon, through moves such as Growl or abilities such as Intimidate.It does not prevent self-inflicted decreases, for example from Superpower.

name: Hustle
description: Hustle increases the ability-bearer's Attack by 50%, however, it also reduces the Accuracy of all Physical moves by 20%.If a Pokémon with Hustle is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

name: Hydration
description: A Pokémon with Hydration will cure itself of any status conditions during rain, at the end of each turn. This includes self-inflicted conditions such as from using Rest.

name: Huge Power
description: Raises the Pokémon's Attack stat.

name: Hospitality
description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it showers its ally with hospitality, restoring a small amount of the ally's HP.

name: Honey Gather
description: Honey Gather has no effect in battle.When a battle ends, any party Pokémon with Honey Gather may pick up honey as a held item (if they are not already holding an item).

name: Heavy Metal
description: Heavy Metal doubles the Pokémon's weight in battle. Increasing weight affects these moves:

name: Healer
description: May heal an ally's status conditions.

name: Heatproof
description: Heatproof reduces the damage taken from Fire-type moves by 50%. It also halves the damage from a burn, from 1⁄8 to 1⁄16 of the Pokémon's maximum HP.

name: Harvest
description: May create another Berry after one is used.

name: Infiltrator
description: Infiltrator ignores the effects of Reflect, Light Screen and Safeguard. In other words, if the opponent has used Safeguard, Toxic would still badly poison them.

name: Hadron Engine
description: Creates an Electric Terrain when entering battle, and boosts Special Attack while active.

name: Guts
description: Guts raises the ability-bearer's Attack by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep). If burnt, the Pokémon does not suffer the usual drop in Attack.All other effects of the status condition remain, e.g. losing HP each turn (poison, burn), speed drop (paralysis) or being unable to attack (paralysis, freeze, sleep).

name: Guard Dog
description: Boosts Attack if intimidated, and prevents being forced to switch out.

name: Illusion
description: When a Pokémon with the Illusion ability switches into battle, it takes the form of the Pokémon in last place (6th) of the player's party. Illusion will not activate if the Pokémon in last place is the same species or is fainted.The effect is aesthetic only; Illusion does not change the Pokémon's type or moves, so for example a Fighting-type move against a Zoroark disguised as Gengar would still be super effective. Any direct attack (i.e. not entry hazards, weather conditions etc) will break the illusion.

name: Gorilla Tactics
description: Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat but only allows the use of the first selected move.

name: Ice Face
description: Ice Face is the signature ability of Eiscue. It allows the Pokémon to take a physical attack without taking damage. After the attack, Eiscue changes to its No Ice Face form, however, it can be restored in hail.

name: Gooey
description: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker's Speed stat.

name: Good as Gold
description: Gives immunity to status moves.

name: Hunger Switch
description: Hunger Switch causes Morpeko to change its form each turn, alternating between Full Belly Mode and Hangry Mode. Morpeko's form also changes the type of its signature move, Aura Wheel.

name: Galvanize
description: Normal-type moves become Electric-type moves and their power boosted.

name: Gale Wings
description: Gives priority to Flying-type moves.

name: Full Metal Body
description: Prevents other Pokémon from lowering its stats.

name: Frisk
description: The Pokémon can check a foe's held item.

name: Gulp Missile
description: Gulp Missile is the signature ability of Cramorant. If Cramorant uses the move Surf or Dive, it returns with a fish in its mouth. If Cramorant then takes damage, it retaliates by spitting out the fish, dealing extra damage.Cramorant may also return carrying a Pikachu. If Pikachu is launched at the opponent they will become paralyzed.

name: Friend Guard
description: Reduces damage done to allies.

name: Forewarn
description: Determines what moves a foe has.

name: Grim Neigh
description: Boosts Special Attack after knocking out a Pokémon.

name: Grassy Surge
description: Grassy Surge creates a low-lying grassy field, like the move Grassy Terrain, when the Pokémon enters battle. It restores the HP of grounded Pokémon each turn and increases the power of Grass type attacks.

name: Grass Pelt
description: Boosts the Defense stat in Grassy Terrain.

name: Fluffy
description: Fluffy reduces damage from contact moves by 50%, but Fire-type moves do double damage. Fire-type moves that make contact do regular damage.

name: Flame Body
description: If a Pokémon with Flame Body is hit by a move that makes contact, there is a 30% chance the attacker will become burned.If a Pokémon with Flame Body (or Magma Armor or Steam Engine) and a Pokémon Egg are both in the party Pokémon, the number of steps required to hatch the egg are halved.

name: Flash Fire
description: When a Pokémon with Flash Fire is hit by a Fire-type move, it does not deal damage but instead raises the power of the bearer's Fire-type moves by 50%. Subsequent hits do not raise the power even more, but the effect remains while the ability-bearer is in battle.

name: Gluttony
description: A Pokémon with Gluttony will use a pinch berry when its HP drops to 50%, rather than the usual 25%.Pinch berries are: Figy, Wiki, Mago, Aguav, Iapapa, Liechi, Ganlon, Salac, Petaya, Apicot, Lansat, Starf, Micle and Custap. (Their descriptions state that they work in a pinch.)

name: Filter
description: Filter reduces the damage taken from super-effective attacks by 25%.For example, a Dark-type move used against a Psychic-type Pokémon with Filter would deal 1.5× the usual damage instead of 2×. A double weakness would be reduced from 4× to 3×.

name: Fairy Aura
description: Fairy Aura raises the power of Fairy-type moves by 33%, for all Pokémon on the field (not just the ability-bearer).It is the signature ability of Xerneas.

name: Fur Coat
description: Fur Coat reduces damage taken from physical attacks by 50%.

name: Embody Aspect
description: Embody Aspect boosts a particular stat, depending on the form of a Terastallized Ogerpon:

name: Electromorphosis
description: If a Pokémon with Electromorphosis is hit by an attack, the power of the next Electric-type move it uses is doubled.

name: Electric Surge
description: Electric Surge creates a low-lying electric field, like the move Electric Terrain, when the Pokémon enters battle. It prevents grounded Pokémon from falling asleep, and increases the power of Electric type attacks.

name: Effect Spore
description: Contact may poison or cause paralysis or sleep.

name: Forecast
description: Castform transforms with the weather.

name: Flower Veil
description: Flower Veil prevents ally Grass-type Pokémon's stats from being lowered, in double and triple battles.

name: Drought
description: Drought creates harsh sunlight when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via Air Lock or Cloud Nine or replaced by another weather condition.If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities (Drought, Drizzle, Sand Stream or Snow Warning) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon.Prior to Generation 6, Drought lasts indefinitely upon activation.

name: Drizzle
description: Drizzle creates a rain shower when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via Air Lock or Cloud Nine or replaced by another weather condition.If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities (Drizzle, Drought, Sand Stream or Snow Warning) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon.Prior to Generation 6, Drizzle lasts indefinitely upon activation.

name: Flare Boost
description: Powers up special attacks when burned.

name: Flower Gift
description: Flower Gift raises the Attack and Special Defense of all party Pokémon by 50% during harsh sunlight.

name: Dragon's Maw
description: Dragon's Maw increases the power of Dragon-type moves used by this Pokémon by 50%.It is the signature ability of Regidrago.

name: Download
description: Download raises either the bearer's Attack or Special Attack by one stage when switching into battle, base on the opponent's defenses.It raises Attack if the opponent's Defense is lower than its Special Defense, or raises Special Attack if opponent's Special Defense is lower than or equal to its Defense.In double and triple battles, Download compares the sum of all opponents' Defense stats and the sum of all opponents' Special Defense stats and uses the lowest total.

name: Disguise
description: Disguise allows the bearer to avoid damage for one attack, in a similar way to Substitute.

name: Defiant
description: Defiant raises the ability-bearer's Attack by two stages when hit by a stat-lowering move.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Emergency Exit
description: Switches out when HP falls below 50%.

name: Defeatist
description: When the HP of a Pokémon with Defeatist falls below 50%, its Attack and Special Attack stats are halved.

name: Dauntless Shield
description: Boosts Defense in battle.

name: Dazzling
description: Dazzling makes the Pokémon immune to high-priority moves (i.e. those with a priority above 0).

name: Earth Eater
description: Restores HP when hit by a Ground-type move.

name: Dry Skin
description: Dry Skin causes several effects:

name: Early Bird
description: The Pokémon awakens quickly from sleep.

name: Dancer
description: When another Pokémon on the field uses any Dance move, Dancer causes the ability-bearer to use that same move immediately afterward. They will still use their own move originally selected, at the usual time (e.g. after the opponent if they are slower).Effects and status conditions apply for both the copied move and original move. For example if the Dancer Pokémon is confused, they may hurt themselves in confusion when using their move and when copying a Dance move.The moves that Dancer can copy are:

name: Cursed Body
description: May disable a move used on the Pokémon.

name: Cute Charm
description: If a Pokémon with Cute Charm is hit by a move that makes contact, there is a 30% chance the attacker will become infatuated. It will not infatuate Pokémon of the same gender, genderless Pokémon, nor those with the ability Oblivious.Infatuated Pokémon have a 50% chance of being immobilized by love each turn and unable to attack.If a Pokémon with Cute Charm is the leading party Pokémon, the chance of encountering a Pokémon of the opposite gender is 2⁄3.

name: Curious Medicine
description: Resets all stat changes upon entering battlefield.

name: Desolate Land
description: Desolate Land creates extremely harsh sunlight when the ability is activated (by Groudon reverting to its Primal form).Extremely harsh sunlight has the same effects as harsh sunlight but with some additions:The abilities Cloud Nine or Air Lock are still able to bypass the effects of Desolate Land, but Mold Breaker is not.

name: Delta Stream
description: Delta Stream creates strong winds when the ability is activated (by Rayquaza Mega-Evolving).Strong winds have the following effects:The abilities Cloud Nine or Air Lock are still able to bypass the effects of Delta Stream, but Mold Breaker is not.

name: Contrary
description: Makes stat changes have an opposite effect.

name: Competitive
description: Competitive raises the ability-bearer's Special Attack by two stages when hit by a stat-lowering move.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Compound Eyes
description: Compound Eyes raises the ability-bearer's accuracy by 30%.In Generations 3-5, this ability's name was formatted as Compoundeyes.If a Pokémon with Compound Eyes is first in the party, Pokémon that can be holding items have that chance increase from 50% to 60% (for common items), 5% to 20% (for uncommon items) or 1% to 5% (for rare items).

name: Dark Aura
description: Dark Aura raises the power of Dark-type moves by 33% for all Pokémon on the field (not just the ability-bearer).It is the signature ability of Yveltal.

name: Comatose
description: Comatose causes the Pokémon to behave as if it were asleep, though it doesn't officially have the Sleep status condition. It can still use its regular moves, but cannot be inflicted with any major status condition (sleep, poison, paralysis, burn, or freeze).Moves that target sleeping Pokémon (such as Dream Eater) work on a Pokémon with Comatose, and the ability-bearer can use the moves Sleep Talk and Snore. The power of Hex and Wake-Up Slap still doubles when targeted at a Comatose Pokémon (though Wake-Up Slap does not suppress Comatose).Comatose cannot be removed or replaced via moves like Skill Swap or the Mummy ability. The move Purify and the Chesto Berry item do not work on a Pokémon with Comatose.

name: Damp
description: Damp prevents all Pokémon on the field from using the moves Selfdestruct and Explosion. It also prevents damage (to the Damp Pokémon only) from the ability Aftermath.

name: Cud Chew
description: Cud Chew causes the Pokémon to reuse an already consumed Berry at the end of the next turn.

name: Cotton Down
description: When a Pokémon with Cotton Down is hit by an attack, it lowers the attacker's Speed.

name: Costar
description: Copies ally's stat changes on entering battle.

name: Color Change
description: Color Change changes the ability-bearer's type, when hit by a damage dealing move, to the type of that move. For example being hit by X Scissor will change the Pokémon to Bug-type. Dual-type Pokémon change to single-types.If a Pokémon with Color Change has a Substitute, the ability does not activate. Color Change activates for the last strike of a multi-hit move.In Generations 3-4, Color Change activates on the first strike of a multi-hit move, thus subsequent hits may be not very effective.

name: Corrosion
description: Corrosion allows the bearer to poison any Pokémon, including Steel and Poison types.

name: Cloud Nine
description: Cloud Nine suppresses all effects brought on by weather, including move power increases, end-of-turn damage, accuracy changes, relevant abilities and so on.

name: Clear Body
description: Prevents other Pokémon from lowering its stats.

name: Chilling Neigh
description: Boosts Attack after knocking out a Pokémon.

name: Cheek Pouch
description: Cheek Pouch restores the bearer's HP when a Berry is consumed, on top of the berry's usual effects.So for example, it may cure a status condition and restore HP, or restore more HP than normal.

name: Chlorophyll
description: Chlorophyll doubles the ability-bearer's Speed during bright sunshine.

name: Analytic
description: Boosts move power when the Pokémon moves last.

name: Anger Point
description: Anger Point raises the ability-bearer's Attack to its maximum level - +6 stages or 4× usual power - when a move targeting it receives a critical hit.

name: Aftermath
description: If an attacker faints a Pokémon with Aftermath using a contact move, the attacker will lose 1⁄4 of their maximum HP.

name: Aerilate
description: Aerilate causes all Normal-type attacking moves used by the Pokémon to become Flying-type, and increase in power by 20%.Flying-type Pokémon also gain STAB from those moves (which means an effective increase of 80%).In Generation 6, Aerilate increases affected moves' power by 30%.

name: Adaptability
description: Adaptability increases the effectiveness of STAB moves from the usual 1.5× to 2×.For example, a Water-type Pokémon using Surf (base power 90) would normally get an effective power of 135. With Adaptability it would be 180 instead.

name: Commander
description: Goes inside the mouth of an ally Dondozo if one is on the field.

name: Bulletproof
description: Bulletproof makes the Pokémon immune to ball and bomb moves.In Generation 6, Rock Blast is not affected by Bulletproof.

name: Air Lock
description: Air Lock suppresses all effects brought on by weather, including move power increases, end-of-turn damage, accuracy changes, relevant abilities and so on.

name: Anger Shell
description: When the Pokémon's HP drops below half, Anger Shell lowers its Defense and Special Defense but its Attack, Special Attack and Speed are raised.
